title: Chicken Karahi with Fresh Ginger & Green Chilli — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat a heavy pan over medium heat and add the rapeseed oil.
Cook the onions for 8–10 minutes until deep golden.
Add garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute.
Stir in tomatoes and ground spices; cook 10 minutes until thick and oil separates.
Lower the heat and stir in the yogurt gradually.
Add the chicken breast and cook until done: chicken 12–15 minutes, beef or lamb 20–25 minutes, fish 8–10 minutes, prawns 6–8 minutes.
Finish with fresh coriander and rest 3 minutes before serving.
plating: Serve in a warmed shallow bowl, meat or fish centred with masala spooned over and coriander scattered on top.
swaps: If you can’t get chicken breast, use boneless thighs (juicier) or turkey breast (similar cook time).
optional_finishes: Pickled green chillies or fermented carrot relish.

title: Beef Nihari (Light, Slow-Cooked) — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat a heavy pan over medium heat and add the rapeseed oil.
Cook the onions for 8–10 minutes until deep golden.
Add garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute.
Stir in tomatoes and ground spices; cook 10 minutes until thick and oil separates.
Lower the heat and stir in the yogurt gradually.
Add the beef shin and cook until done: chicken 12–15 minutes, beef or lamb 20–25 minutes, fish 8–10 minutes, prawns 6–8 minutes.
Finish with fresh coriander and rest 3 minutes before serving.
plating: Serve in a warmed shallow bowl, meat or fish centred with masala spooned over and coriander scattered on top.
swaps: If beef mince isn’t available, use lean turkey mince or lamb mince; keep spices the same and drain excess fat if needed.
optional_finishes: Pickled green chillies or fermented carrot relish.

title: Sindhi Prawn Masala — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat a heavy pan over medium heat and add the rapeseed oil.
Cook the onions for 8–10 minutes until deep golden.
Add garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute.
Stir in tomatoes and ground spices; cook 10 minutes until thick and oil separates.
Lower the heat and stir in the yogurt gradually.
Add the raw king prawns and cook until done: chicken 12–15 minutes, beef or lamb 20–25 minutes, fish 8–10 minutes, prawns 6–8 minutes.
Finish with fresh coriander and rest 3 minutes before serving.
plating: Serve in a warmed shallow bowl, meat or fish centred with masala spooned over and coriander scattered on top.
swaps: If prawns aren’t available, use chunks of white fish or chicken thigh; add them at the end so they don’t overcook.
optional_finishes: Pickled green chillies or fermented carrot relish.
